intro: Aethusa cynica, commonly known as hemlock water-dropwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is a biennial herb that grows up to 1.5 meters tall, featuring finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in umbrella-like clusters called umbels. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been introduced to other regions. Aethusa cynica contains toxic compounds and is considered a potential weed in agricultural settings.
